intro: Mesosphaerum araripense, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit, is a unique plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a small, flowering shrub that belongs to the family Onagraceae. The plant is characterized by its clustered, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or white in color. Its fruit, which resembles a small star, is edible and has a tangy, citrus-like flavor. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
